\FloatBarrier
```{r}
#| label: fig-normal # label for cross-ref, see below
#| fig-cap: "Standard Normal Distribution" # caption
#| fig-align: center
#| out-width: "30%" # scale graph as % of text width
#| echo: false # prevents code from being shown in the pdf
#| warning: false # suppress warnings
#| message: false # suppress messages from packages

library(ggplot2)

x <- seq(-3, 3, length.out = 200)
y <- dnorm(x, mean = 0, sd = 1)
normaldata <- data.frame(x, y)

ggplot(normaldata, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_density(stat = "identity") +
  theme_po33q +                             # make graph transparent & remove chart junk  
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=15),    # set axis label size
        axis.title=element_text(size=18))   # set axis title size

```
\FloatBarrier

Here we can use the label we set in the code chunk to refer to Figure \ref{fig-normal}.


Including a \texttt{modesummary} table is straightforward:


```{r}
library(modelsummary)
library(tinytable)
library(carData) # only needed for data to illustrate this here

data("Prestige", package = "carData") # only needed for data to illustrate this here

m1 <- lm(prestige ~ education, data = Prestige)
m2 <- lm(prestige ~ income + type, data = Prestige)
m3 <- lm(prestige ~ education + income, data = Prestige)

models <- list("(1)" = m1, "(2)" = m2, "(3)" = m3)

cm <- c(
  "education"   = "Years of Education",
  "income"      = "Average Income",
  "(Intercept)" = "Constant"
)

# Create the modelsummary table
modelsummary(models, 
             title = "Regression Models",
             gof_omit = 'DF|Deviance|Log.Lik|F|AIC|BIC|RMSE', 
             stars=TRUE,
             coef_map = cm,
             escape = FALSE,                                # needed for spacer below
             notes = "\\vspace{0.1\\baselineskip}",         # add space before caption
             notes_append = TRUE)|>                         # this is the custom row
  group_tt(j = list("Bivariate" = 2:3, "Multivariate" = 4)) |> # emergence/survival in assignment
  group_tt(j = list("Dependent Variable: Prestige Score" = 2:4))|> # add header
  theme_latex(outer = "label={tblr:regmodels}")|>           # label for crossref
  theme_latex(placement= "H")|>                             # place table [H]ere
  theme_latex(resize_width= 0.5, resize_direction="both")   # adjust table size (% of textwidth)
```
